fields.summary: Official support for Microsoft SQL Server 2012 R2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34197].
  {panel}

Consider the following setup:
* A confluence page contains the 'Blog Posts' macro with the display setting set to 'excerpts'
* A blog post that does not have an excerpt set, and does contain a URL within its first few sentences

Result:
The URL is displayed in full, rather than the link text and HTML link (like what is displayed if an excerpt were to contain a link).
fields.summary: Blog Posts Macro renders URLs as text when content = excerpts and post contains no excerpt
Blueprints Java API does not have Javadocs

fields.description:
After upgrade, some pages with Wiki Markup content are failed to be migrated to XHTML format. This content consists of: - Information Macro - Numbered List inside Information Macro - Section / Column - Heading 2 - Table *Steps to replicate* # Create an empty page with title 'TEST' # In the database, update the bodycontent of the new page with the following storage format: {code} INLINE {code} # Restart Confluence # Perform unmigratedcontent.action in Admin panel # The page 'TEST' is not properly migrated to XHTML with the following Storage Format: {code}
  1. The quick brown fox # Jumps over the lazy dog # The quick brown fox the lazy dog

The quick brown fox jumps

date








There is lazy dog


h2. Fox month year

|The quick| |   2'000.00| |./. AHV/IV/EO 5.05%|     101.00 | | |./. ALV 1.00%|       20.00 | | |./. UVG 1.25%|       25.00 | | |./. Brown Fox |     41.75 | | |Dog total | | ./. 187.75 | |Lazy |-| | |Jumps over | |      90.00| |Quick | |   1'902.25 |

{code}
fields.summary: Content with Wiki Markup Fail to be Migrated After Upgrade
Add ability to bulk delete page history

fields.description:
When using LDAP-based external user directory, including group management, changing the Case (upper/lower/mixed) of a group name in LDAP results in incorrect behavior:
 *  "odd" logins (1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, ...) result in a successful login (password check), but a "Not Authorized" result.
 *  "even" logins (2nd, 4th, 6th, ...) result in a successful login and proper authorization.

Two things about this:
  1.  Odd/Even login should not matter: why is the code behaving differently depending on whether it's the first/second login?
  2.  All comparisons between authorization criteria (e.g., group names) should occur by first "lowercaseing" both sides.
fields.summary: LDAP-based external user directory bug
Remove deactived users from @Mention suggestion list
submit called twice in Blueprint wizard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34189].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
* answer a question => "success" dialog is shown
* navigate away
* use browser history / back to get back to previous question
=> "success" dialog is shown again.

This made me think for a moment that I was double-posting. I'd expect the success dialog only to be shown after actually submitting a response.
fields.summary: Post success message in answers is shown again on browser history back
Bundle the RSVP Macro with Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34186].
  {panel}

The caret/cursor may not appear in Confluence's edition window.

1) Go to a page
2) Bonk on "Edit"
3) There is no caret being drawn

It is still there because typing/editing "blindly" works.

To make it reappear, perform some editor action, e.g. unmark, then mark "Notify watchers", or even just click outside the Firefox windows, then go back.
fields.summary: Confluence TinyMCE editor's caret/cursor not drawn
Option to auto archive content of external link(s)
Keyboard shortcut to close an editing session

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34182].
  {panel}

We already can do a lot with keyboard in the Confluence editor. However, one thing that always bugs me is that I need to use the mouse to bring up the macro editor for a selected macro.

Proposal:
ALT+SPACE Could bring up the list of actions for a given macro (normally Edit/Remove). Then I need to be able to move in this list using TAB/SHIFT+TAB. A Following ENTER would execute the action. This behavior would be especially useful for macros defining their own action (status, team calendar etc.)

ALT+ENTER would instantly do the default action. In almost all cases this is bringing up the macro editor.

In normal cases this behavior would be enabled when the macro is 'text'-selected. One option to think about would be to also extend this behavior to the macro directly following the text cursor. Would remove the need to first SHIFT+ARROW the macro.

Please have a heart for our keyboard loving users and make it happen. thx!
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open the macro editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34181].
  {panel}

In Confluence 5.5.1/5.5.2, there is a a line of ')''s (parenthesis) under the Group Management (http://confluenceurl/admin/users/browsegroups.action) directly above the name heading of the groups table. 

Their number is the number of groups listed in the table + 1 as we can see in the screenshot below:

!usermanagement.png!

PS: Tested in Confluence *5.5.3 version* and the behaviour *does not* persist.
fields.summary: Parenthesis in the Header of Group Management
Option to Change the Email Notification for Request Access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34175].
  {panel}

We want to provide our users with their favourite pages and favourite spaces on the dashboard.
Currently we use the 'favourite pages'-macro and the 'spaces list'-macro.
While the 'favourite pages'-macro features a consistent design,
the 'spaces list'-macro is out of the ordinary (screenshot).

What we would like to see is (for instance) the possibility to tell the 'favourite pages'-macro to show the favourite spaces.

Add Cancel Button for Directory Synchronisation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34172].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* user *testuser* creates a personal space on a given instance
* user *testuser* exports that space and imports it on another instance - due to [CONF-29898|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29898], that personal space will be imported as a global space, however the key of the space will be *~testuser*
* user *testuser* tries to create a personal space - Confluence will hang since it already exists a space with the *~testuser* key

!personal_space.png!
fields.summary: Cannot create personal space

fields.description:
Version: Atlassian Confluence 5.1.3
Issue: Receiving "Failure when converting editor format to storage format" error when trying to save a page.

Description: When copying and pasting text from Sprint! (JIRA) into Confluence Editor, that has mark-up icons like (?) to insert a question mark image, which is then deleted, when I save the page I get this error.

Steps to reproduce:
# Copy already saved/posted text with mark-up icons from Sprint! (JIRA), such as the following without quotes: "(?) test test test"
#* In JIRA, this text will show up as a "?" icon image followed by the text:
#* !jira.png!
# Paste this text into the Confluence editor.
# Delete only the (?) icon character, and not the entire string of text.
# Attempt to save the page and get the following error:
#* !editor.png!

If I click the < > button to get into the XML editor I get the following error:
" Error loading source
    RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (java.lang.NullPointerException) (500)"
fields.summary: Failure when converting editor format to storage format in 5.1.3
Creating JIRA issues from Confluence pages generate JavaScript errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34169].
  {panel}

Hello, I am getting information hidden on a wiki article:

http://wiki.vontu.corp/display/TS/List+of+ports+used+with+DLP

this information is publicly available:

http://www.symantec.com/business/support/index?page=content&id=TECH221622
fields.summary: Confidential notice over publically documented information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34168].
  {panel}

We provide a lot of SQL code snippets to our admins/devs within Confluence and use the code macro to do so.

Some of the scripts are pretty lengthy (like 100s-1000s of lines).

Therefore, we would love to see a 'copy to clipboard' button within the macro (maybe optionally with a parameter) so the admin has the option to copy all the content of the macro to the clipboard in one go and continue to his database administration studio or whatever, instead of scrolling down 1000 lines to copy everything.

What do you think?
fields.summary: Add button to copy Code Macro content to clipboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34166].
  {panel}

Pressing shortcut "B" when *[viewing all pages or all blogs in a space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+All+Pages+in+a+Space]* does not prompt to create a new blog post. 

!https://support.atlassian.com/secure/thumbnail/851808/_thumb_851808.png!

The shortcut can only be done when users viewing a page or blog post. 

This action should not be a constraint when viewing recently updated pages or blogs.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut "B" Create New Blog in View All Updated Pages and Blogs

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:

# Create a page with multiple line of content
# place the cursor at top left(begins of the content)
# press "pageDown" button from keyboard

*Expected behavior:*  The cursor will go to the bottom of the page and the page will scroll to bottom of the page too

*Actual behaviour:*  Only cursor moved to bottom of the page


*Additional note:*

 IE 11 working just fine without problem

Similar to this bug  CONF-34104
fields.summary: Page does know scroll when pressing pageDown in Editor For IE 9, IE 10

User should not be able to attach a file without any permissions.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34162].
  {panel}

We would like to import several documents (containing tipps and tricks) into our new confluence-instance.

To date these documents are sorted by date (which makes sense - because the current ones are easily identifiable).

Now, every document is going to be transfered into one page.
What we are looking for is a possibility to manipulate the date of creation for every page, so that it reflects the "date of creation" of the original document.
fields.summary: Change date of creation for a page

See attached what we put into /opt/confluence/bin/setenv.sh at the beginning of the file.

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34154]. {panel} h6. Problem * mailto links work fine when added to a Confluence page ** aka mailto:user@asdf123.com will result in opening a mail client to send mail to mailto:user@asdf123.com * using the Confluence Page Gadget to view this same page, the link will instead be directed to address domain.com Expected Behaviour is that the link will also result in opening a mail client to send mail to mailto:user@asdf123.com h6. Steps to Reproduce * Create a new page in Confluence * Add a link to the page mailto:user@asdf123.com * Save page, confirm the behaviour * In JIRA, add the Confluence Page macro * Once displayed, observe that clicking the link does not actually trigger the mail event Viewing the link source, we see: * In Confluence's page, the working link: {code} mailto:user@asdf123.com {code} * In JIRA via the Confluence Gadget macro: {code} mailto:user@asdf123.com {code}
fields.summary: mailto links are not properly formed when using Confluence Page Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34153].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

* user A creates a test page
* user B created a child page on the test page and restrict edit/view to himself
* user C moves test page to another space. The page is moved, but not the child page (as expected). However, it could be useful if a warning was shown stating that are child restricted pages that will not be moved.

This is specially helpful when you are moving pages to delete the space. In this case, the child restricted pages will be lost. The warning would allow the user that is moving the page to notify users with restrict pages to move them as well.
fields.summary: Move pages behavior could be improved

fields.description: When embedding an PDF into a page via the PDF macro the content does not fully populate. This has been tested on 5.5.2 and 5.5.3 and has shown to be the case during the attempt to render.
fields.summary: View File Macro not rendering complete PDF 5.5.2

fields.description:
Pages containing links into another space will still contain them after you delete the space; those links retain the hyperlink style and becomes a no-op link to #; following them has no effect, which is confusing and frustrating; the visual editor does not offer the possibility to unlink them except by placing the cursor behind them and pressing [Backspace], which is hardly discoverable; invoking the link editor has no effect.
The expected behavior is to inform the editor that the target space has been deleted and offer a way to search for similar pages.
fields.summary: The visual editor does not support editing a link into a deleted space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34149].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Total Remaining Estimate values are not showing in Jira issue macro in Confluence.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Configure applink between JIRA and Confluence
 # Create a DEMO project in JIRA
 # Create a sub-task to one of the issue
 # Add Remaining Estimate value for the parent and sub-task issues
 # Create a page, add JIRA Issue Macro with filter of {{project = DEMO}}
 # Include {{Σ Remaining Estimate}} for the _Columns to Display_
 # Search in JIRA using {{project = DEMO}} and compare the results

h3. Expected Results

The value should be showing correctly in Confluence as it is already in JIRA.
h3. Actual Results

The Σ Remaining Estimate values are missing.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Additional Information

Last reproduced on Confluence 6.15.6 and JIRA 8.2.4.
Issue can be seen on the following column as well:
* Σ Original Estimate
* Σ Time Spent

 Screenshots of JIRA, Confluence, and XML data from JIRA search
 !Selection_004.png|thumbnail! !Selection_005.png|thumbnail! !Selection_006.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro not showing value for Σ Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34148].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At present, an unlimited number of users can concurrently edit a page. As a result, the last user that saves could potentially overwrite content to the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide users the ability to limit the number of users who can concurrently edit, or disable the feature entirely and allow only one user at a time to edit. Additionally, can add a temporary lock to a page that might have a lot of edits in a certain amount of time.
 
h3. Workaround 
Restrict Editing to certain users in [Page Restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions]
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to disable or limit number of concurrent users editing a page
make links on space directory relative

fields.description:
I an using the atlassian sdk on Ubuntu 12.10 to create blueprints. Since we are using Confluence 5.2.5, I am running atlas-run --version 5.2.5 to make sure the blueprint runs on our machine. Using this command throws an exception on the commandline. The server starts up, but when I open the URL in my browser, I see the default tomcat 404 page.

atlas-version gives:
{code}
ATLAS Version:    5.0.3
ATLAS Home:       /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3
ATLAS Scripts:    /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3/bin
ATLAS Maven Home: /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3/apache-maven-3.2.1
--------
Executing: /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3/apache-maven-3.2.1/bin/mvn --version -gs /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3/apache-maven-3.2.1/conf/settings.xml
Apache Maven 3.2.1 (ea8b2b07643dbb1b84b6d16e1f08391b666bc1e9; 2014-02-14T18:37:52+01:00)
Maven home: /usr/share/atlassian-plugin-sdk-5.0.3/apache-maven-3.2.1
Java version: 1.7.0_60, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "linux", version: "3.5.0-51-generic", arch: "amd64", family: "unix"
{code}
The exception is attached
fields.summary: atlas-run throws exception when used with --version 5.2.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34145].
  {panel}

Drag-and-drop feature has been a useful feature in Confluence where users can drag and drop pdf and documents without hassle.

There are times when users wants to drag multiple files (at a time) and insert attachment links rather than expecting the embedded macro to appear.

The current workaround for the user is to drag the file into the page and manually remove the embedded macro during edit mode.

It will be awesome if there will be a function to enable or disable the auto-embedded macro, and then insert the attachment links instead when users perform drag-and-drop in Confluence Edit mode.
fields.summary: Disable Embedded Macro while drag-and-drop in Edit mode

fields.description:
h6. Steps to Replicate

# Insert a Top Users macro to a fresh page and space, limit events to create and update
# Create a new user
# Login as the new user
# Create a new content (with the new user) in the fresh space
# Verify that the new user appears in the Top Users macro with create/update stat = 1
# Delete the page created in step 4 with another user (admin user)
# Verify that the new user still appears in the Top Users macro, with create/update stat = 1

h6. Observed Behavior
The Top User Macro displays a user which his page already been deleted.

h6. Expected Behavior
The Top User Macro should not display the user which his page already been deleted.
fields.summary: User are still appearing in the Confluence Usage stats after their page is deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34141].
  {panel}

Creating a page and adding 2 Page Properties without ID i.e.:
|purchase|p1|
|status|In Progress|
|Comment|Waiting on shipment|

|purchase|p2|
|status|TDB|
|Comment|Currently in Procurement|

Will only show one of them in the report after adding the label to the page, even though no ID was entered.
The help and comments on closed bug reports suggest this was fixed a few versions back.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro fails to show all Page Properties in the same page with matching keys

fields.description:
When using IE 11, the Insert > Symbol function results in a plain white box with no content. IE 9 Firefox and Chrome all produce the expected set of symbols for selection.
h2. Resolution

Upgrade to Confluence 5.8.16 or newer.
fields.summary: Confluence Insert Symbol function not working in IE 11

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Use Microsoft Office and create 4 doc/docx files with some content on it.
# Save into a local directory.
# Create a Space.
# Go to Space Tools > Content Tools > Import tab
# In import directory put the path to the directory where you saved the files created in step 1.
# Click in Import.
# The spaces will not be created.
(i) Tested With FF and Chrome using customer data.

h4. Workaround

# Create a Blank Page.
# Click In Tools > Import From Word Document
# Select your Word Document.

Make categories in Space Directory visible only to users who can access the spaces
Ability to set a expiration date in invitations to Confluence.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34134].
  {panel}

Confluence social features are great to engage user adoption, but when opening Confluence to external customers, this may cause a privacy breach. It would be great if those features could be easily disabled in Confluence, at least to some users and/or spaces.

Some of the problematic features are:
* People Directory.
* user mentions.
fields.summary: Confluence private mode

fields.description:
We are currently experiencing a serious issue with page restrictions. We have pages with restrictions, that have sub pages, which were created by users, that were deleted from the user directory in the meantime. These root-pages have read restrictions, set for a particular group. However, these sub pages are listed in the activity stream and are also discoverable for users through global search, that are not a member of the particular allowed groups, set in the page restrictions. 

The global search will display these restricted articles and unauthorized users can fully open these pages. Opening these articles does also cause a "500 Internal Server error".

Note: the affected pages/ subpages were migrated from version 4.x to 5.x.
fields.summary: Subpages don't inherit permissions from parent pages (see comments for solution)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34132].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new space with Default theme and Global colour scheme.

2. Change theme, eg. to Atlassian’s Documentation theme or in our case, to our own custom theme. Global Colour Scheme has been replaced by either Theme Colour Scheme (Documentation theme) or Custom Colour Scheme (own custom theme).

3. Switch back to Default theme. The colour scheme won’t revert back to Global Colour scheme but stays the same as after previous step.

I think it’s not a bug in a theme, since it doesn’t matter if the other theme is Atlassian’s Documentation Theme or our own custom theme. 

This is not a major issue, but could be very confusing if individual space admins will just want to try a different theme for a moment but want to change back to original. Restoring the original situation need some extra steps to complete.
fields.summary: Space’s colour scheme won’t revert back to Global colour scheme if the theme is changed from Default to some other and back.

fields.description:
When there is a new notification (number shown next to the notification box icon), the first invocation of the notification box fails.
Steps:
- do some change that will trigger a notification
- open confluence
- click on the notifications icon
- the notification box is loaded with the 'Notifications' title, the two buttons and the 'Loading' spinner.
- nothing is loaded and the spinner just stays there
- close the box, click on the notifications icon again
- everything works

After inspecting, I saw that on the first click some async calls are not invoked, and no errors are reported neither on client nor server side. When the box is closed and the notifications icon is clicked again, the async calls are invoked, all data is loaded properly and everything is rendered without problems.

When there are no new notifications, everything works OK even on the first try.

Note: on page load with jQuery the whole DOM of the button and the menus is moved to a different div container (for layouting purposes).
fields.summary: Notification box fails to load
add additional parameter in User Profile macro to search for specific username

fields.description:
Now that we made sure that text-replacement macros are used really consistently (for consistency of spelling) I had to find out that content rendered from those macros is not found.
E.g.:
macro yFrontendServer
no macro body
template:
{code}
## @noparams
Frontend Server
{code}

If I search for
frontend server
and the page has this text only rendered from the macro, then it is not found.

This is an absolute showstopper / emergency bug for us, because we would have to change thousands of pages.
We always wondered why Confluence search was relatively bad. This may be one of the reasons that I stumbled across accidentally after more than two years.
fields.summary: Text rendered from user macro not found

fields.description: A blueprint must be valid XML, if it is not the plugin will install without any error or warning.  When a user tries to create a page with the invalid blueprint, the create button will spin indefinitely with no user message.
fields.summary: No validation on Blueprint Template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34126].
  {panel}

We're finding the decision register really useful but there is one feature that I think would really increase productivity - the ability for notifications to be sent out for pending decisions on a configurable basis.

We're starting to use the decision register for a lot of the technical decisions we make as architects within our company. A lot of these decisions can take time to make. To encourage people to keep on top of them I send out an E-mail on a regular basis, but it would be ideal if this was automated.

I am guessing the nature of a decision register page means it is not particularly structured, i.e. it is just a regular page with some pre-selected markup? A temporary workaround could be to use the REST API I guess to pull this info out, I just don't know if there would be anything that would distinguish a decision register page from any other page.

Thanks
Michael
fields.summary: Automated follow up notifications for pending decisions in the decision register

fields.description:
Was able to reproduce this bug on CAC and Confluence master.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Type a blank line in the editor
2. On the next line, type some text
3. Start selecting from the start of the blank line to the end of the next line
4. Hit delete (on mac)
5. Only the blank line is deleted, the second line of text remains in the editor
fields.summary: Deleting a selection that starts with a blank line in Firefox does not delete the entire section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34121].
  {panel}

I just created a "Meeting Notes" page from blueprints, using the suggested template and subject. After filling it in, I shared it with an email address.

I have attached a picture of the email that was sent.

* Subject is not useful. Should include space name. (or be editable? Doesn't need the "Xavier has shared with you..."
* If content of page was included inline, it would be easier for people to scan.

To work around this, I'm manually sending an email and copy+pasting the page into the body, then copy+pasting a link to the page.
fields.summary: "Share" feature needs better subject and include content inline

fields.description: When you open the confluence editor and write a bracket, if you hit Cmd+z or Ctrl+z on the right timing, the bracket will be changed to a double slash (due date macro) as we can see in the video below.
fields.summary: Brackets turns into due date macro if Cmd+z or Ctrl+z is pressed right after

fields.description:
to recreate this problem:

1. create a new page in some space "A"
2. create a new task on that page, assigned to me
3. save the page
4. move the page to another space "B"
5. go to the Tasks page of my Profile
6. notice two things:
 a. the task is listed TWICE
 b. NEITHER task can be closed from the POV of the Profile/Tasks page.  Clicking the checkbox next to the task appears to close the task; but when you refresh the Tasks page, the task is once again unchecked.
7. However: when you view the task from the page in space "B", it is marked as Closed. (checked)
fields.summary: Task cannot be closed if page on which it was created is moved to another space
Update the atlassian-user.xml reference documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34117].
  {panel}

Users are able to all outgoing links in page by accessing [Viewing Page Information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+Page+Information].

However, there is no definite function to view all outgoing links in space or view detailed information on the space.

There is a similar function called [View Space Activity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+Space+Activity] but does not display other details such as outgoing links, recent changes and so on.

It would be great if there can be a way to view a summary of contents and outgoing links in a space.
fields.summary: Space Info View All Outgoing Links in Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34116].
  {panel}

*Symptoms*
* Tasks do not appear or are missing from the list of tasks in Task Reports Macro
* Users are not notified of tasks, nor do they show up in their My Tasks panel.

*Cause*
* Tasks using Anchor Links (for example: https://example.com#anchor) will throw an error in the log and will not appear in the related pages.

Reenable daily digest emails on CAC
A template of pre-linked pages for creating user guides

fields.description:
Google documents are often referred to using links of the following type: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHN5NTEckm6k6cdL92d6KHJjgor0nmOenTAsquCrA5I/edit. Using these links in the widget connector does not work. The current workaround is to remove the /edit portion of the link and ensure that it terminates with a #. The following is an example of a functional google document link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHN5NTEckm6k6cdL92d6KHJjgor0nmOenTAsquCrA5I#.

The widget connector should be updated such that it can automatically handle edit links.
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work with edit links
Widget Connector does not work with Google Spreadsheets or Draw documents
Per attachment access control
better support for weblinks
Do not snap to top of page when entering preview mode

fields.description:
I have noticed now several times that after running the stop_service.bat the script displays the message "The Atlassian Confluence service could not be stopped." yet the exit code returned by the script is 0.

This is completely messing up my backup scripts that I'm trying to implement.

c:\Scripts>"%PROGRAMFILES%\Atlassian\Confluence\stop_service.bat"
The Atlassian Confluence service is stopping....
The Atlassian Confluence service could not be stopped.


c:\Scripts>echo %errorlevel%
0
fields.summary: service could not be stopped with exit code 0

fields.description:
Here is the steps to reproduce the issue:
# Create a page with a 3x3 table
# Insert a code macro in the middle of the table
# Add around 30 line code in the code macro
# Move the cursor to the top of the page, then press the PageDown button to move the cursor 

*Expected behavior:* the cursor should move to the empty line after the table if pressed the button three times, as 30 lines is around 2 pages string.

*Actual behavior:* the cursor stuck at the box of first column and second row, no matter how many times we press the button.
fields.summary: PageDown is not working correctly when editing page with Firefox on Windows

fields.description:
As shown in the screen shot, the due date is showing strange date for the month March, October and December, as the shortcut is different: 

||English||German||
|Mar|Mrz|
|Oct|Okt|
|Dec|Dez|

!Screen Shot 2014-06-26 at 16.39.34.png!

*Updated*:
This bug affects custom fields *and* system fields (due date, created, updated).
Both variants of the displayed date/time do *not* match the configured date/time format of *any* application (JIRA / Confluence).
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro showing strange due date with German language

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue : 

# Open a child page, which will make the page tree expanded.
# Navigated to its parent page 
# Close the page tree expand on the sidebar
# Refreshing the parent page

Expected behaviour: The page tree should keep closing. 

Actual behaviour: the page tree is expanded again.
fields.summary: Sidebar did not persist user action on page tree

fields.description: Really height image is cut off while converting a confluence page to PDF.
fields.summary: Really height image is cut off while converting a confluence page to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34099].
  {panel}

Back in Confluence 2.3 the default search was set to AND for CONF-1881

In 5.1ish it was switched back to OR.  I've tried to adjust, but it drives me nuts.  

This is clearly a personal preference more than anything.  Both JIRA and Confluence have changed the default at least once.  Could we make this a per-user setting please?  And an easy per-search toggle?

I'm really sick of having to add + or AND to every search
fields.summary: Default search behaviour should be "AND" for multi-term search or at least configurable

fields.description:
Nir Goldshlager have discovered a vulnerability on atlassian-gadgets when parsing XMLs.

Basically anyone can craft a URL containing a parameter with some XML that will make the instance run out of memory when trying to parse it.

Details on the attack can be found on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38884

The vulnerability was detected on our fork of apache shindig, which atlassian-gadgets depends on. We have made a fix and published a new version for it (1.0-incubating-atlassian-20) that solves the problem.

Any product that uses atlassian-gadgets to render gadgets is vulnerable to this, and Confluence is one of those.

You would need to check your current version of atlassian-gadgets and see which version of apache shindig is using. Anything lower than 1.0-incubating-atlassian-20 would make Confluence vulnerable to this attack.

The fix is quite easy, just bump the version of shindig on the version of gadgets that you are using. Then release a new version of gadgets and bump the version on Confluence to pick up the fix.

If you need any details, ping me @jsanchez.
fields.summary: Remote DoS Exploit on Confluence

fields.description:
PDF files can not be (reliable) viewed in Confluence 5.x.x
(the CONF-31759 workaround doesn't change this... deals with other topic)

Let me sum up what I've learned about the bug:

* occurs predominant on Windows hosted system
* 1st view of pdf always works
* after time Confluence starts creating *.part files in viewfile directory (in additon to the existing -> from now on some pages of the pdf are not rendered (the bug)
* the viewfile directory and it's temp directory is heavily used under Windows during viewing a pdf if you delete the content of the viewfile directory and it's temp, 1st view of pdf always works (so a startover)

And this cannot be debugged to it's root cause and fixed by Atlassian ?
fields.summary: View File Macro not rendering complete PDF on Windows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34095].
  {panel}

This is a request for a new feature which could restrict/define the usage of specific plugins/macros to only allowed users. For example: 

# Restrictions based on users and groups
# Controlled by normal Confluence page edit restrictions as an additional feature for the *Tools* dropdown.

We can see a similar feature for this [Bob Swift Third-Party|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.macrosecurity] plugin, but, Confluence doesn't work with this as a bundled one.
fields.summary: Define the security for which plugins can be used by which users on which pages
Make Email Notices Configurable

fields.description:
If you go to Confluence Admin > Global Templates and Blueprint and edit one of our bundled templates to add a local variable it will show up in preview mode, however it will not appear when you use the edited template.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Confluence Admin > Global Templates and Blueprint. 
# Edit the "Product Requirements" template.
# Add some local variables:
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
# If you do a preview those variables will show up:
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
# Now use the edited Product requirement:
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!
# You will see the variables will not be in there.
fields.summary: Local variables created in our bundle templates do not appear when the template is used

fields.description:
Dear,

We hava a space in Confluence, called "SURFdrive Support". In this space we have created a template , the name of this template is "Issue Template". 

When we select the template and fill it in and want to save it we're getting the error: PAGE NOT FOUND.

I don't know what's getting wrong. I already checked the URL base configuration of Confluence, but that's not the problem and i removed the caches and restarted Confluence but i also didn't help.

I created a support zip which is attached in this issue.

Thank you!
fields.summary: There is no Action mapped for namespace /pages and action name docreatepagefromtemplate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34090].
  {panel}

Blocks of "preformatted" text are very "hard" to break.

Not sure how to explain this (is there a 'markup visible' mode?). Let's try:

1) Several lines of "preformatted text" as seen in image 1. The last line is marked, because we want to change the formatting ("Create database")

2) We want to change style to "heading 3" as seen in image 2.

3) The result is that all the preformatted text is somehow affected by the style change -- everything becomes "heading 3" as seen in image 3.

4) CTRL-Z that. Wanting to add a line break, move the caret to the end of "parallel" as seen in image 4. (Caret drawn in because I cannot be screen-captured)

5) Return bampfs the caret to the end of the preformatted block of text instead of adding an empty line (image 5). Rage ensues.  (Caret drawn in because I cannot be screen-captured)

6) To add an empty line, one has to set the caret to line start, then press enter, resulting in an empty line being inserted before the current one (Yes, I realize there is a LF instead of a CRLF here ... but this just bad)

7) Image 6: Mark text, read to apply "heading 3"?

8) Image 7: Oops! Fuuuuuu!!!!

9) I can't even remember how I reached Image 8....
fields.summary: "Preformatted" text behaves annoyingly not like several lines of monospace text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34089].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
Confluence sends the daily _Recommended Updates_ e-mail even when there's no activity.

*Details:*
The [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Subscribing+to+Email+Notifications+of+Updates+to+Confluence+Content] says: _If there is no activity to report, Confluence will not send the email message._
However, even if there's no activity on the instance, Confluence keeps sending the daily e-mail with the same content as the last e-mail sent.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Configure your Confluence to be able to send e-mails.
# Set the default schedule for sending the recommended updates e-mail to *Daily*, under under *Confluence Admin > Recommended Updates Email > Default Schedule*.
# Be sure that your user has a valid e-mail configured under its account details.
# Create a page in Confluence with *another user* and save it.
# Like and comment on the page with the user who created the page.
# The e-mail is sent at 1P.M everyday, so set the date time on your instance's server to 1P.M of the next day.
# Wait for the e-mail on your inbox.
# Set the server date time to 1P.M of the next day again.
# The same e-mail as the last one will be sent.
fields.summary: Daily email being sent even when there's nothing new
Provide the ability to create a link in Confluence that will open in a new tab

fields.description:
When following the steps below, Confluence will triplicate (multiply by three) the Panel macro by adding two new blank Panel macros (one on top, one on bottom).

Steps to reproduce:

1.	Create new confluence page
2.	Click into body
3.	Hit Bold button (or CTRL+B)
4.	Add Panel macro - leave default settings
5.	Add expand macro into Panel Macro - leave default settings
6.	Type some text into expand macro (it will be bold, but it is expected) - See img1.png
7.	Hit Bold button (or CTRL+B) again

Result: There will be copy of the Panel below and above the original, but without any content (see img2.png).

Expected behaviour: the word inside the expand macro will be unbold and the excessive panel macros should not be displayed.
fields.summary: When unbold text, the panel macro will multiply by three

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* Edit a page
* Make a change
* Click Preview - this should produce a message that your draft has been autosaved (view change) but does not
* Click Cancel
* Click Edit - at the top there is a message that says: A version of this page you were editing at (date and time) was saved as a draft. Do you want to view the change, resume editing or discard it?
The link for "view the change" does not do anything. See screenshot.

This was observed on 3 instances of Confluence 5.0.3 and on both Firefox and Chrome browsers.
fields.summary: Anomalous Editing in Confluence 5.0.3
test summary for Jira PROJECT
details and detailssummary macros broken
Colour for Highlighting Text Background
Ability to see all the tasks in one page.
Allow better styling of @mentions in Confluence

fields.description:
If you go to a Confluence page that contain special character in it's name and use the Multimedia Macro the mp4 file will not display.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Page, "Band: Kaiser Chiefs"
# Go to Tools > Attachments and add a mp4 file.
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
# Back to Band: Kaiser Chiefs edit the page.
# Add the multimedia macro to display the mp4 file, note that the file will not show up.
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) This happens with accents characters, if you use a "&" this behaviour will not show up.

h4. Work Around 1
# Edit the page "Band: Kaiser Chiefs"
# Remove the any accents you have in the page name.
(i) Using my previous example the name of the page will change to "Band Kaiser Chiefs".
# Save the page.
# Edit and try to add the attachment again.

h4. Work Around 2
# While the page is open (edit mode), drag and drop the mp4 file, so it will display accordingly.
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro does not display attached mp4 files when the Page name Contain special characters

fields.description:
# Create PAGEA
# Attach image files mypage-a.png, mypage-a-b.png
# Create PAGEB
# Edit PAGEB. Open Insert Image dialog. Search for images.
# Queries "mypage-a.png", "mypage-a-b", "mypage-a-b.png" return nothing.
fields.summary: Image search is broken in Insert Image dialog if image name contains hyphens

fields.description:
# Create space SPACEA
# Add page MYPAGE
# Comment on that page
# Create space SPACEB
# Move MYPAGE from SPACEA to SPACEB
# Observe that SPACEA recent activity still shows MYPAGE commented event. MYPAGE created event is correctly listed under SPACEB recent activity.
fields.summary: After moving page to another space page commented events still listed in recent activity of original space
